newsitem.title: DUBAI: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Feb 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Feb 9.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the United Arab Emirates press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Saudi Arabia's King Fahd marks Eid al-Fitr feast marking the end of the fasting month of Ramadan by expressing concern over bloodshed in Moslem countries.
- Gulf markets capitalised at $90.7 billion, report says.
- Two million Moslems pray in the holy city of Mecca to celebrate the Eid al-Fitr feast.
- The Abu Dhabi National Oil Company said the Ruwais industrial area will become the largest in the Gulf.
- Iraqi Deputy Prime Minister Tareq Aziz tells Japanese television that President Saddam Hussein's eldest son Uday, who was shot last year, needs more surgery.
- The United Arab Emirates offset programme has implemented 18 projects so far with 980 million dirhams invested in the schemes, official says.
